LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 19, 2025
Heidi MARIE Raubenolt
Legacy Adoption Services - East
2170 E. Big Beaver Rd. Suite 1490
Troy, MI, 48083-2375
RE: License#: CB630201258
Dear Ms. Raubenolt:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 1/17/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• Technical assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this inspection period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator
reported that LAS has been working intently with MDHHS Adoption program office
to address systemic delays to timely permanency for children eligible for adoption.
The CA reported the agency continues to center their efforts on the unique needs
each child presents and to work with partner agencies on trends to develop
upstream on the child welfare services continuum. The CA reported the agency
was fortunate to have a quality manager within their agency who is dedicated to
assisting the staff to stay on top of trends and continually find ways to leverage the
tools available to ongoing data and continuous quality improvement.
Financial Overview:
Reviewed the agency independent auditor’s report dated December 31, 2023, and
the agency annual financial report. There were no financial concerns identified.
Staff Interviews:
Four staff were interviewed via telephone. All staff interviewed had been with the
agency ranging from 7, 8, 10 and 24 years. Staff contribute their longevity to
working for a great agency who cares about their staff well-being and resources
for the staff. Staff reported no concerns and love working with all of the children
and families, but they would appreciate and suggest having staff who just work
with unmatched children due to some of these children not wanting to be adopted
and can be on their caseload up to two years. Working with children who are
matched gives the staff benefit in making sure adoptions are handled more
quickly.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has the space and equipment needed to perform job requirements.
The files are stored securely to prevent unauthorized access.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This is not applicable. This is an adoption agency only and not contracted with
MDHHS to provide foster care placement or certification services.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
1/17/2025

Pinkey Brown Date
